medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the message and specification of its function.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment identifying the date/time of message generation and/or other date/times concerning the whole message.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment specifying references to other related message(s) or batch(es), e.g. a previous message.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment giving free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying information about the whole message.

medi:segment.name: Currencies
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CUX, A segment specifying the currency in which all the monetary amounts are expressed in the message.

medi:segment.name: Control total
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CNT, A segment specifying aggregate information concerning the whole message, e.g. number of claims, number of parties, number of patients, etc.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving total amounts for the whole reimbursement message, and the relevant tax information if any.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment specifying total amounts for the whole reimbursement message.

medi:segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TAX, A segment specifying the tax type if relevant.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: DTM-STS-RCS-PDI-FII Parties Segment Group. A group of segments giving information about involved financial, administrative and medical parties such as requester, payee, insurance organisations, insured family and service providers, or their representatives.

medi:segment.name: Party identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PNA, A segment specifying the identity number and name of a party.

medi:segment.name: Sequence details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SEQ, A segment allocating a sequence number to the individual party allowing each party to be referenced from within the message.

medi:segment.name: Address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ADR, A segment specifying address(es) of the party.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment identifying a person or department to whom contacts should be directed and their function.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment giving communication type and number of the party.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
RFF, A segment specifying alternative identification numbers of the party.
This segment also facilitates reference to another party if the current party is related to another party such as a department in a hospital, a physician in a department, etc.

medi:segment.name: Relationship
medi:segment.medi:documentation: REL, A segment specifying the relationship with another party.

medi:segment.name: Nationality
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAT, A segment specifying the nationalities of the party.

medi:segment.name: Language
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LAN, A segment specifying the language used by the party.

medi:segment.name: Organisation classification details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SPR, A segment specifying the type and (medical) speciality of an organisation.

medi:segment.name: Employment details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: EMP, A segment specifying the type and (medical) speciality of a person as well as his/her position within an organisation.

medi:segment.name: Qualification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QUA, A segment specifying the professional (medical) qualifications of the party.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying validity dates or any other date related to the party.

medi:segment.name: Status
medi:segment.medi:documentation: STS, A segment specifying the status of involvement for the party (former, previous, current, next).

medi:segment.name: Requirements and conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RCS, A segment specifying administrative conditions of a party, such as the type of location from which a healthcare professional operates, (e.g. town, countryside, mountain area), identifier for agreement on reimbursement mode and tariff, or other statutory information.

medi:segment.name: Person demographic information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PDI, A segment specifying demographic information such as sex, marital status, and other demographic information.

medi:segment.name: Financial institution information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FII, A segment identifying an account number and a financial institution related to the party.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: Contracts Segment Group. A group of segments related to the whole message, specifying contracts between insured parties or between patients and insurance institutions, and detailing insurance coverage.

medi:segment.name: Agreement identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: AGR, A segment identifying the type of the insurance contract.

medi:segment.name: Sequence details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SEQ, A segment allocating a sequence number to the individual contract allowing each contract to be referenced from within the message.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment specifying certificate numbers and other references related to the contract. This segment is also used to hold a reference to administrative parties in the Parties Segment Group where the related insurance organisation or institution is identified.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates, times and periods related to the contract such as period of validity and period of specific coverage.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments specifying detailed information about rights and insurance coverage.

medi:segment.name: Insurance cover description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ICD, A segment identifying the insurance scheme or product covering the patient.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying a particular term of the insurance scheme or product, specified in the ICD segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: External documents Segment Group. A group of segments giving the identification of external documents the message is referring to (e.g. forms, regulation texts, etc.).

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DOC, A segment specifying the type and the name of a document.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates related to the document. (e.g. issuing date, validity date, etc.).

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments providing information about parties related to the document, such as signatories, sender and receivers.

medi:segment.name: Party identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PNA, A segment identifying the party.

medi:segment.name: Address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ADR, A segment specifying the address of the party.

medi:segment.name: Status
medi:segment.medi:documentation: STS, A segment specifying the involvement status of the party (former, previous, current, next).

medi:segment.name: Requirements and conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RCS, A segment specifying administrative conditions of a party such as the social sector it belongs to.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation:
Segment group 7: This segment group provides information about a reimbursement claim: identification of patient(s), and the healthcare services provided to the patient(s).
The reimbursement claim specified in this segment group may be related to any party specified in the Parties Segment Group, any insurance coverage as specified in the Contracts Segment Group or any transport activity as specified in the Transports Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Financial charges allocation
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FCA, A segment specifying whether reimbursement is due to the patient, to the healthcare service provider, or to a combination of both.

medi:segment.name: Processing information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GEI, A segment specifying the service type of the actual reimbursement claim, i.e. whether this is a new reimbursement claim, modification of a previous reimbursement claim, cancellation of a previous reimbursement claim or a complete replacement of a previous reimbursement claim.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
RFF, A segment specifying certificate numbers and other references related to the reimbursement claim.
This segment may also be used to hold the reference to administrative, financial, and medical parties of the Parties Segment Group, insurance contracts of the Contract Segment Group and transport activities of the Transports Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates, times and periods related to the reimbursement claim.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, for specifying information about the reimbursement claim.

medi:segment.name: Agreement identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: AGR, A segment identifying the type of the insurance contract related to the reimbursement claim.

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
DOC, A segment specifying documents the reimbursement claim is referring to.
This segment may also be used to hold a document reference of the external documents Segment Group.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 8: To specify total amounts, and the relevant duty/tax/fee information about the current reimbursement claim.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment specifying total amounts such as total amount to pay.

medi:segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TAX, A segment specifying relevant tax information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 9: This segment group provides information about required administrative conditions concerning the reimbursement claim, such as risk identification (e.g. illness, maternity, accident, industrial accident).

medi:segment.name: Requirements and conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RCS, A segment specifying requirements and conditions concerning the reimbursement claim.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying a particular condition specified in the RCS segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation:
Segment group 10: This segment group identifies the patient(s) to whom the medical services of this actual reimbursement claim have been provided and information about any related person, or other name or identity of the patient.
This segment group may also be used to specify name and identity of any other party related to the actual reimbursement claim, and involved in the medical or administrative process provided to the patient(s). In this case, only the PNA segment is used.

medi:segment.name: Party identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PNA, A segment identifying the patient, related person, or party identity number and name.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
RFF, A segment specifying the identification numbers of the person or other identification references such as card number.
This segment may also be used to keep the reference to administrative, financial, and medical parties of the Parties Segment Group, and insurance contracts of the Contracts Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ADR, A segment specifying the details of the patient and related person(s) place of residence, or any other address or location related to the person, such as place of birth.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment providing a telecommunication number for the person.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying relevant dates/times for the person such as date of birth, date of death or date identification card was issued.

medi:segment.name: Person demographic information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PDI, A segment specifying demographic information such as sex, marital status, and other demographic information.

medi:segment.name: Result
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RSL, A segment specifying the result of a clinical examination, such as the height or weight of the patient.

medi:segment.name: Nationality
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAT, A segment specifying the nationality of a person.

medi:segment.name: Language
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LAN, A segment specifying the language used by the person.

medi:segment.name: Handling instructions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: HAN, A segment specifying confidentiality constraints on person data.

medi:segment.name: Relationship
medi:segment.medi:documentation: REL, A segment specifying the relationship between a related person and the patient. This relation can be an organ donor- receiver relationship, a mother-child relationship or any other family relationship.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation:
Segment group 11: SG12-SG13-SG14-SG15 A group of segments describing a medical activity. A medical activity can be a collection of several detailed medical activities which are all related to the same medical treatment.
The medical activity specified in this segment group may also be related to any party specified in the Parties Segment Group, any insurance coverage description as specified in the Contracts Segment Group or to any transport activity as specified in the Transports Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Process identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PRC, A segment specifying the type of medical activity provided such as hospitalisation or outpatient treatment.

medi:segment.name: Processing information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GEI, A segment specifying the service type for the medical activity: new activity, modification of a previous activity, cancellation of a previous activity or replacement of a previous activity.

medi:segment.name: Status
medi:segment.medi:documentation: STS, A segment specifying the activity status regarding its achievement (e.g. started, in progress, terminated) and/or payment (e.g. received, granted, paid).

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment identifying the actual medical activity, and allowing several alternative coding schemes depending on separately agreed criteria.

medi:segment.name: Clinical information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CIN, A segment justifying the medical activity provided in terms of diagnosis or clinical observation.

medi:segment.name: Party identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PNA, A segment specifying the identity number and name of any medical or administrative party related to the current activity, such as treatment provider or prescriber, diagnosis originator, etc.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates, times and periods related to the current medical activity such as date performed, date of prescription, date of sickness and date of medical authorisation.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, To specify a reference related to a treatment such as identification number of prescription or medical authorisation number. This segment may also be used to hold the reference to administrative, financial, and medical parties of the Parties Segment Group, insurance contracts of the Contracts Segment Group and transports of the Transports Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, specifying information about the current medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment providing quantities related to the medical activity such as number of units of service as identified in the IMD segment. If the service type of this medical activity is a modification then variations from the original quantities are given here.

medi:segment.name: Percentage details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCD, A segment specifying percentage used to calculate a share of a reimbursement. This information is useful when a party has already paid a certain amount, or more generally when several recipients are identified in the business scenario (e.g. 75% of a visit will be paid to the general practitioner and 25% to the patient).

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments specifying healthcare administrative information about the patient.

medi:segment.name: Attendance
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAS, A segment specifying patient administrative information such as administrative status concerning current hospital stay or outpatient visit or ward stay related to the patient.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment specifying the physical location of patient care in terms of ward, room, bed, etc.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying admission and/or discharge date and time or start and/or end date and time of a ward stay.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, This segment holds the reference of a healthcare party for specifying healthcare administrative information such as hospital, department, etc. where patient is admitted, located, etc.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 13: To specify total amounts, and the relevant duty/tax/fee information about the current medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment specifying total amounts such as amount of fees.

medi:segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TAX, A segment specifying relevant tax information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 14: This segment group provides information about required medical and administrative conditions concerning the current medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Requirements and conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RCS, A segment specifying requirements and conditions about the current medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying a particular condition specified in the RCS segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation:
Segment group 15: PAC-SG16-SG17-SG18 A group of segments describing a detailed medical activity.
The detailed medical activity specified in this segment group may also be related to any party specified in the Parties Segment Group, any insurance coverage description as specified in the Contracts Segment Group or to any transport activity as specified in the Transports Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Clinical intervention
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CLI, A segment specifying a clinical intervention.

medi:segment.name: Processing information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GEI, A segment specifying the service type of the current detailed medical activity, i.e. whether this is a new detailed medical activity, modification of a previous detailed medical activity, cancellation of a previous detailed medical activity or a complete replacement of a previous detailed medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment identifying the current detailed medical activity and allowing several alternative coding schemes depending on separately agreed criteria.

medi:segment.name: Clinical information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CIN, A segment specifying the reason for applying the current detailed medical activity in terms of diagnosis or clinical observation.

medi:segment.name: Party identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PNA, A segment specifying the identity number and name of any medical or administrative party related to the current activity, such as activity provider or prescriber, diagnosis originator, etc.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates, times and periods related to the current medical activity such as date performed, date of prescription, date of sickness and date of medical authorisation.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
RFF, To specify the reference related to a detailed medical activity such as identification number of prescription and medical authorisation number.
This segment may also be used to hold the reference to administrative, financial, and medical parties of the Parties Segment Group, insurance contracts of the Contracts Segment Group, and transports of the Transports Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, specifying information about the current detailed medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
QTY, A segment specifying quantities related to the detailed medical activity such as number of units of service as identified in the IMD segment.
If the service type of this detailed medical activity is a modification then variations from the original quantities are given here.

medi:segment.name: Percentage details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCD, A segment specifying percentage used to calculate a share of a reimbursement. This information is useful when a party has already paid a certain amount, or more generally when several recipients are identified in the business scenario (e.g. 75% of a visit will be paid to the general practitioner and 25% to the patient).

medi:segment.name: Package
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAC, A segment specifying package and number of physical units for drugs or any other materials.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 16: To specify total amounts, and the relevant duty/tax/fee information about the detailed medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment specifying total amounts such as amount of fees.

medi:segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TAX, A segment specifying relevant tax information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 17: This segment group provides information about required administrative conditions about the reimbursement claim, such as risk identification (e.g. illness, maternity, accident, industrial accident).

medi:segment.name: Requirements and conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RCS, A segment specifying requirements and conditions concerning the current detailed medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying a particular condition specified in the RCS segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments providing information about the equipment used to provide the current detailed medical activity.

medi:segment.name: Equipment details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: EQD, A segment identifying the equipment used.

medi:segment.name: Sequence details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SEQ, A segment specifying the sequential number of the activity performed on the equipment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 19: Transports Segment Group. A group of segments specifying a transport activity related to the provision of a medical service. A transport activity comprises of several transport phases, each transport phase can be made up of several detailed transport activities.

medi:segment.name: Transport movement details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TMD, A segment specifying journey trip such as a journey from a hospital to a patient home.

medi:segment.name: Sequence details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SEQ, A segment allocating a sequence number to the transport activity, allowing each transport activity to be referenced from within the message.

medi:segment.name: Processing information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GEI, A segment specifying the service type of the transport activity: new transport activity, modification of a previous transport activity, cancellation of a previous transport activity or replacement for a previous transport activity.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, specifying information about the whole transport activity.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation:
Segment group 20: A group of segments specifying one transport phase. A new phase can result from vehicle changes, crew changes, different stages, different numbers of people transported, different rates, etc.
The transport activity specified in this segment group may also be related to any party specified in the Parties Segment Group such as transport service provider.

medi:segment.name: Transport information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment identifying the transport service provider, the kind of transportation used, and the vehicle.

medi:segment.name: Processing information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GEI, A segment specifying the service type of the actual transport phase: new transport phase, modification of a previous reported transport phase, cancellation of a previous reported transport phase and replacement for a previous reported transport phase.

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment identifying the current transport activity and allowing several alternative coding schemes depending on separately agreed criteria.

medi:segment.name: Party identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PNA, A segment identifying the party transported and the transport service provider, such as a driver.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation:
RFF, A segment specifying references concerning the actual transport phase such as authorisation number.
This segment may also be used to hold the reference to administrative, financial, and medical parties of the Parties Segment Group, and insurance contracts of Contracts Segment Group.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, specifying information about the current transport phase.

medi:segment.name: Clinical information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CIN, A segment specifying the reason for the current transport phase in terms of diagnosis or clinical observation.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment specifying quantities related to the transport phase, such as number of people transported.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments specifying the transport legs and relevant dates and times.

medi:segment.name: Address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ADR, A segment specifying the address details of the transport phase such as location of departure and arrival.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying relevant dates and times for the transport phase such as date/time of departure, arrival and elapsed time.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 22: This segment group provides information about special circumstances affecting the transport phase.

medi:segment.name: Transport service requirements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TSR, A segment specifying special circumstances affecting the current transport phase.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying a particular circumstance specified in the TSR segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments providing information about each transport phase specifying the transport components to be used for financial calculation.

medi:segment.name: Charge/rate calculations
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TCC, A segment specifying charges for a transport component.

medi:segment.name: Processing information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GEI, A segment specifying the service type of the actual transport component, i.e. whether this is a new transport component, modification of a previous transport component, cancellation of a previous transport component or a complete replacement of a previous transport component.

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment identifying the current transport component such as night trip, day trip, toll gate and highway.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates and times concerning the current transport component.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, To specify references of a transport component.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying the current transport component.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment specifying quantities related to the transport component such as number of km.

medi:segment.name: Percentage details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCD, A segment specifying percentage used to calculate a share of a reimbursement. This information is useful when a party has already paid a certain amount, or more generally when several recipients are identified in the business scenario (e.g. 75% of a transport will be paid to the transport service provider and 25% to the patient).

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 24: To specify total amounts and the relevant duty/tax/fee information.

medi:segment.name: Monetary amount
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MOA, A segment specifying total amounts such as amount of fees.

medi:segment.name: Duty/tax/fee details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TAX, A segment specifying relevant tax information.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 25: This segment group provides information about special circumstances affecting the current transport component.

medi:segment.name: Transport service requirements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TSR, A segment specifying special circumstances affecting the current transport component.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, illustrating or justifying a particular circumstance specified in the TSR segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments providing an authentication result for the message. This segment group can also be used for authentication results of message sender or receiver.

medi:segment.name: Authentication result
medi:segment.medi:documentation: AUT, A segment specifying the result of an authentication procedure.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying dates and times of an authentication result.
